panels.description:
Percentage of targets successfully scraped by prometheus.scrape
components.

This metric is calculated by dividing the number of targets
successfully scraped by the total number of targets scraped,
across all the namespaces in the selected cluster.

Low success rates can indicate a problem with scrape targets,
stale service discovery, or Alloy misconfiguration.
panels.title: Scrape success rate in $cluster

panels.description:
Duration of successful scrapes by prometheus.scrape components,
across all the namespaces in the selected cluster.

This metric should be below your configured scrape interval.
High durations can indicate a problem with a scrape target or
a performance issue with Alloy.
panels.title: Scrape duration in $cluster

panels.description:
Percentage of samples sent by prometheus.remote_write that succeeded.

Low success rates can indicate a problem with Alloy or the remote storage.
panels.title: Remote write success rate in $cluster

panels.description:
Latency of writes to the remote system made by
prometheus.remote_write.

targets.expr:
sum(rate(prometheus_remote_storage_sent_batch_duration_seconds_sum{cluster=~"$cluster", namespace=~"$namespace", job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", component_path=~"$component_path", component_id=~"$component"}[$__rate_interval])) /
sum(rate(prometheus_remote_storage_sent_batch_duration_seconds_count{cluster=~"$cluster", namespace=~"$namespace", job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", component_path=~"$component_path", component_id=~"$component"}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.title: Write latency in $cluster

panels.description:
How far behind prometheus.remote_write from samples recently written
to the WAL.

Each endpoint prometheus.remote_write is configured to send metrics
has its own delay. The time shown here is the sum across all
endpoints for the given component.

It is normal for the WAL delay to be within 1-3 scrape intervals. If
the WAL delay continues to increase beyond that amount, try
increasing the number of maximum shards.
panels.title: WAL delay

panels.description:
Rate of data containing samples and metadata sent by
prometheus.remote_write.

targets.expr:
sum by (instance, component_path, component_id) (
    rate(prometheus_remote_storage_bytes_total{cluster=~"$cluster", namespace=~"$namespace", job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", component_path=~"$component_path", component_id=~"$component", url=~"$url"}[$__rate_interval]) +
    rate(prometheus_remote_storage_metadata_bytes_total{cluster=~"$cluster", namespace=~"$namespace", job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", component_path=~"$component_path", component_id=~"$component", url=~"$url"}[$__rate_interval])
)

panels.title: Data write throughput

panels.description:
Total number of shards which are concurrently sending samples read
from the Write-Ahead Log.

Shards are bound to a minimum and maximum, displayed on the graph.
The lowest minimum and the highest maximum across all clients is
shown.

Each client has its own set of shards, minimum shards, and maximum
shards; filter to a specific URL to display more granular
information.
panels.title: Shards

panels.description: Total outgoing samples sent by prometheus.remote_write.
panels.title: Sent samples / second

panels.description:
Rate of samples which prometheus.remote_write could not send due to
non-recoverable errors.
panels.title: Failed samples / second

panels.description:
Rate of samples which prometheus.remote_write attempted to resend
after receiving a recoverable error.
panels.title: Retried samples / second

panels.description:
Total number of active series across all components.

An "active series" is a series that prometheus.remote_write recently
received a sample for. Active series are garbage collected whenever a
truncation of the WAL occurs.

NOTE: This metric is not available when using prometheus.write.queue component.

targets.expr: sum(prometheus_remote_write_wal_storage_active_series{cluster=~"$cluster", namespace=~"$namespace", job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", component_path=~"$component_path", component_id=~"$component", url=~"$url"})

panels.title: Active series (total)

panels.description:
Total number of active series which are currently being tracked by
prometheus.remote_write components, with separate lines for each Alloy instance.

An "active series" is a series that prometheus.remote_write recently
received a sample for. Active series are garbage collected whenever a
truncation of the WAL occurs.

NOTE: This metric is not available when using prometheus.write.queue component.

targets.expr: prometheus_remote_write_wal_storage_active_series{cluster=~"$cluster", namespace=~"$namespace", job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", component_id!="", component_path=~"$component_path", component_id=~"$component", url=~"$url"}

panels.title: Active series (by instance/component)

panels.description:
Total number of active series which are currently being tracked by
prometheus.remote_write components, aggregated across all instances.

An "active series" is a series that prometheus.remote_write recently
received a sample for. Active series are garbage collected whenever a
truncation of the WAL occurs.

NOTE: This metric is not available when using prometheus.write.queue component.

targets.expr: sum by (component_path, component_id) (prometheus_remote_write_wal_storage_active_series{cluster=~"$cluster", namespace=~"$namespace", job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", component_id!="", component_path=~"$component_path", component_id=~"$component", url=~"$url"})

panels.title: Active series (by component)
